response.answer_text: Government didn’t deliver the first railroads, smart phones, cars or light bulbs, so I’m not sure why you’re looking to them for clean technology innovation. The first ever research quantifying how to shift to an economy that consumes greenhouse gases instead of emitting them was released in April 2017. Solutions | Drawdown One of its key findings was that the top 80 currently practical solutions for getting to drawdown (drawing GHG out of the atmosphere) within 30 years were all open to business/community collaboration today. And there’s a further twenty “coming attractions” close to being ready. 2017 is also the year that Apple joined The Circular Economy and Google launched a renewable energy startup (geothermal), both following the lead of corporate climate leaders like Interface and Dell. If you’re in government and want to accelerate this economic transition, then Drawdown’s prioritised solutions list is a good starting point. Summary of Solutions by Overall Rank | Drawdown If you’re not in government and you want action, then take an entrepreneurial look at the same list and find your own opportunities to do well by doing good. Beware of succumbing to Bystander Effect and the media mythology about cost, consumer guilt and government action. If you can run a project, you can be part of the fun - and part of delivering the savings of $74 trillion in costs avoided that Drawdown’s 70 advanced researchers estimated to be available over the next 30 years.
